str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To stretch forth, mid: To hanker after, long for, be eager for, aspire to.
Stronger, more excellent. Comparative of a derivative of kratos; stronger, i.e. better, i.e. Nobler.
From epi and ouranos; above the sky.
Wherefore, on which account, therefore. From dia and hos; through which thing, i.e. Consequently.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To be ashamed, be ashamed of. From epi and aischunomai; to feel shame for something.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: (a) To call (name) by a supplementary (additional, alternative) name, (b) mid: To call upon, appeal to, address.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To make ready, prepare. From hetoimos; to prepare.
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
